H3.text: who controlled the house and the senate in 2012. Democratic

A4.text: House Republicans were still able to retain a 234 to 201 seat majority.

A5.text: The Democrats ended up retaining majority control of the Senate, picking up two net seats.

A6.text: The 2012 elections were also the first since 1996 where a president and a House majority of different parties were simultaneously elected.
